title: Mike Pence ends White House campaign after struggling to gain traction.
description: Pence is the first major candidate to leave a race that has been dominated by his former boss-turned-rival, Donald Trump. His struggles underscore just how much the former president has transformed the Republican party.

title: Mexican security authorities raise Hurricane Otis death toll to 39
description: Acapulco was struggling Saturday to recover from the extraordinarily powerful storm. The picturesque Mexican tourist haunt had never experienced a Category 5 hurricane like Otis, which roared ashore Wednesday and made local landmarks built over decades look like they had been bombed.

title: South Africa beat New Zealand 12-11 to win record fourth Rugby World Cup
description: Handre Pollard kicked four penalties to help South Africa to a nail-biting victory over 14-man New Zealand in the Rugby World Cup final on Saturday to claim a record fourth title.

title: Tyson Fury-Francis Ngannou fight: Why Saudi Arabia is entering the ring
description: On Saturday, the English boxing match between the Briton and the Cameroonian mixed martial artist will kick off the 2023 edition of the Riyadh Season, a festival organized in the Saudi capital.

title: In French Polynesia, dog overpopulation is making residents' life miserable with bites, accidents and noise
description: The dog population in French Polynesia is estimated at nearly 500,000, almost twice as many as the 280,000 human residents. Animal protection organizations are calling for mass sterilization campaigns for these often stray animals.

title: The training camp where Ukrainians prepare for combat: 'Here, they can make mistakes'
description: Some young civilians, who fear a mobilization will be 'inevitable,' are enrolling in paid training programs that teach them military combat skills.

title: Macron proposes a 'maritime humanitarian coalition' to help civilians in Gaza
description: At the end of the European Council on Friday, the French president discussed the possibility of transferring patients and delivering medical supplies and food to Gaza. He assured that 'contacts' had been established with the Israeli authorities.

title: Iran's latent front in Syria poses a real threat to Israel
description: Pro-Iranian militias have strengthened their presence in the south of the country, posing an additional threat to Israel in the event of a ground offensive in Gaza.

title: At least 32 dead in Kazakhstan coal mine fire
description: Kazakhstan's President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev said on Saturday that steel giant ArcelorMittal was the 'worst' company in 'our history' after a fire at a mine owned by the Luxembourg-listed group killed more than 32 people.

title: Israel accelerates its military operations in the Gaza Strip
description: The army claims to have carried out 150 strikes on underground infrastructures used by Hamas in the north of the Gaza Strip. The scale of attacks  remained difficult to gauge, especially as communications in the Palestinian enclave have been cut off since Friday.

title: Gaza death toll: A highly political controversy
description: In response to the White House's accusations of manipulation of the death toll in Gaza from Israeli bombing, Hamas has published a list of the names of more than 7,000 people killed since October 7.

title: Israel says it 'hit 150 underground targets' in night of intensive attacks targeting Hamas tunnels
description: No official death toll was given after Friday night's offensive that also knocked out all of Gaza's communication networks, but the level of bombardment was unprecedented since the start of the war on October 7.

title: Spanish Catholic clergy sexually abused more than 200,000 children, report estimates
description: Presenting the findings, Spain's national ombudsman criticized the church's response to abuse and recommended the establishment of a reparation fund.

title: US, China pave way for a Biden-Xi meeting next month
description: President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping have agreed to meet on the sidelines of next month's Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in San Francisco, according to a US official familiar with the planning.

title: Switzerland: Outspoken xenophobia gains ground at the ballot box
description: Having won the parliamentary elections on Sunday, October 22, the populist SVP party refuses to accept the far-right label, which aligns with its ideology. Its communication, however, is hardly subtle.

title: Since Hamas attacks, Israel's Palestinian minority dreads reprisals: 'I'm afraid we'll take 10 steps backward'
description: Since the murderous Hamas raids, the minority has been treated like a 'fifth column,' as in Haifa, a large 'mixed city,' where a significant number of both Jews and Arabs live. Students and employees have been punished, suspended or dismissed. Their online speech is monitored.

title: Maine mass shooting suspect found dead according to authorities
description: The suspect in a mass shooting in the US state of Maine has been found dead of a self-inflicted gunshot wound, US media reported Friday, after an intense manhunt that lasted more than two days.

title: Wild chimpanzees also experience menopause
description: This is a first for a wild primate. In the community of Ngogo, Uganda, females continue to live up to 10 years after the end of their fertile period, according to a study published Friday in the journal 'Science.'
